Summary: I've stayed at the Big A several times within the past two years often for extended stays.   The managers and staff have always been very friendly, helpful, and accommodating. They are always looking for, and go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable and comfortable. The Motel is generally quiet and peaceful.  I work during the day and wake up early, so a good night sleep is a must. I sleep well and feel safe.  My room is serviced daily, so after work I always return to a clean room and clean towels. If there are any issues they are dealt with promptly by the managers. I've no complaints, and I'm thankful for all the effort the staff and management take to make sure their guest stays are as pleasant as possible.

I checked in and laid on the bed for 5 minutes. In that time I had 3 bed bites. I asked for a refund and he said there was nothing he could do. I called Priceline whom I booked through and they said they couldnâ€™t issue a refund because the hotel claimed there were no bed bugs. Disgusting filthy place that no one should ever stay in. Horrible service as well. Run far away.

Summary Heading: Couldnâ€™t even stay it was so gross
Summary: This room (216) was absolutely disgusting. I am not a snob when it comes to hotels/motels But I literally left because it was so gross. The place looked like it had never been cleaned. The walls had what I can only describe as spitballs on it and the ceiling had some yellow glob of goo hanging down right over the head of the bed. The phone honestly looked like someone may have smeared feces all over it. There was dirt, cigarette burns, and dead bugs randomly on most areas of the room. The bed was horribly uncomfortable (I only sat on it) the headboard was for a full size bed and not the king in the room, the freezer had some melted pink slime and debris in it, and there was something smeared on the wall next to the toilet paper roll. I could go on, but just look at some of the

Located close to Disneyland and surrounding Restaurants, this Hotel is a great choice. The prices are reasonable and tyhe Staff are very accomodating. My room was clean and comfortable with Fridge, Microwave, sitting area and Cable TV. Nice plave for the money.

Summary Heading: Looking for a place close to Chapman University? Stay here at your own peril.
Summary: You get a vibe as soon as you check-in.  At check in instead of being asked "how many keys would you like?", the clerk seemed annoyed that she'd have to start the key-coding process again after tossing me one key...  But that's just the beginning.  The good news: No roaches or vermin (that were visible to the eye).  And the bad---oh, the filthy room.  It looked as though many surfaces hadn't been dusted in years (see photo of my finger-swipe along the headboard).  The bathroom door was practically falling off (see close up of hinge assembly).  The coup de grace---not one, but many stains on the bed sheet---a reddish-brown color (see picture).  Could it have been blood? For sure it wasn't the paint color of the room.  Slow, intermittent internet, even though their transmitter was
Room tip: The room was fairly quiet (near the front).  The rear is probably quieter.

Summary: We chose this place because it was close to Chapman University for Homecoming weekend. So letâ€™s give a star for location.   But the room was filthy. Every surface needed cleaning although the linens seemed clean enough so we stayed there. The. On day two we noticed flecks of what are probably blood on the sheets. We were exhausted so covered that part up with towels so we could go to sleep. The walls were stained, the bed frame coated in dust, the bathroom tiles covered in nastiness.   We couldnâ€™t wait to leave. And when we got home, every item that was in the motel room went straight into the washer.

Giving 2 stars because they accommodated our late arrival after Disneyland. 3 queen bed room, 3 adults, 3 children.  Pros: fairly close to parks, nearby convenience store & fast food, inexpensive in relation to resorts and hotels just outside the gate. Microwave and fridge (unsure if they work).   Cons: room/bathroom were filthy and obviously not cleaned. Water spots on the mirror in the bathroom, hair and dead bugs on bathroom floor, mold and dirt (I hope) on tile. White stains all over shower curtain and furniture. Soap wrappers and toilet paper left in toilet (unflushed) from last customer (?) They opened the window in the room before we arrived... but it still smelled incredibly musty. The AC unit is extremely loud. We chose to not use the comforters ðŸ˜³   This place is "meh"

I have been to this Motel a few times. Front Desk Couple, is always nice and friendly.  I stayed in room 220.. Loved how clean it was. so many places to go eat, close by, walking distance.  Will definitely be back again!!!

Nice spacious room big comfortable bed easy check in and affordable late check out. Very good place for a quick rest. I would come back i been here numerous of times. Everyone is so nice  check then out
Manager Response: Thank you hope to see you soon.

Summary: Great service! Very friendly! Accommodate us very well. Beds are so comfortable!! Ask for special request and right away helped towards the situation no hesitation! Will definitely come back well worth the price!

I work late hours and Big A has been a my choice as a last minute oasis. The hotel is close to my work and close to 5 major freeways and attractions. The check in is fast and friendly. The rooms are spacious and clean. Comfy beds and a great value.

Wow, the Big A was delightfully clean, and very reasonably priced. The staff were very pleasant. The 7/11 is handy, and driving in and out of the motel was easy. We were pretty close to the entrance, and it was really quiet. oh, and the bed - super comfy. My favorite motel in Orange, will definitely visit again.

I mean, it's a Motel, what do you expect? Its not a 5 star hotel.  I stayed there because I didn't want to spend $300 for a nicer place!   We were going to the UFC fight at Honda Center, which was 1.4 miles away. ( $7 uber)   The room was ok.  The bed was ok.   The staff was ok.   Nothing special.    The 4pm check in time is NOT Flexible at all. Even if a room is available, they will NOT check you in early.  Dont even ask.

This was NASTIEST motel i have EVER stayed in, in my life.  I literally woke up with but bites on my legs.  I was to grossed out when I woke up that I IMMEDIATELY booked another place and left to take a shower.  The dust and dust mites here are so piled up I woke up with bloody noses twice, and we come out here A LOT for Disneyland, I have never had problems like we did here.  PLEASE do not take kids here and even adults be cautious.  I tried to find another hotel room the night we got back from Disney land but everything was booked.  So we slept 5 hours and left. My husband told me to move the bed to get pics of bugs and I honestly was just so grossed out I did not want to see any MORE bugs, I did try to get pics of them but they would run OR fly away when is try. Black hair

Summary Heading: nice stay at Big A Motel
Summary: My husband and I stayed at Big A Motel for my daughter's graduation at Chapman University.  I was very concerned about staying at this motel because of the bad reviews. Still, I reserved the place because it is walking distance to Chapman University  and 3 min drive from my daughter's rental house. We were pleasantly surprised! The room was clean, big, and spacious. The hotel owner was very nice and let us have late checkout.

We booked this room last minute for a business trip. The staff was very accommodating and helpful - they were even able to upgrade our bedroom which was awesome.  We stayed for one night, but are definitely open to staying at this place again.

Summary Heading: Does what it says on the tin
Summary: I'm glad I was working a lot when I stayed here, as the motel was basic. I had to ask for extra toilet roll twice.   Did not get a very warm welcome.   If your looking for somewhere cheap and not bothered about comforts. Stay here.

This was sold to us as a 3 star property by Hotels.com.  I wouldn't even give it 1 star...  The front desk clerk sits behind a solid glass wall reserved more for a bank or convenience store in a bad area.  The room was dirty and in very poor condition.  Out in front of our room were abandoned cars and old appliances.    We did contact hotels.com and they tried to resolve this through the hotel management.  In the end, the hotels.com rep told us the manager was incredibly rude and refunded our money.    My learnings on this one was stick with national brands.

Stayed just one night with my family and wasnt what I expected not satisfied at all even though it was for a night there was Nat flys in the sink and was charged for the night $88 plus remote fee that was returned never again

After booking 3 days and being assured that all I needed was a confirmation number , I was not allowed to check in , the desk clerk was rude and stated he was the motel manager he said his name was Jayden . He went on to state that he didn't care if I made a complaint. I will never recommend this place to anyone. Thanks to the booking agency I got a total refund.

Why I gave them 4 stars? Here's why first, they have friendly staff, second they good guest service and third, they almost close in Disneyland. Everything is good and one thing they should change the perfume in the room because it smell weird. They have almost clean in the room and they have microwave and refrigerator. One thing is really good in this place is they are close in 7 eleven why I said good because you can get snack if you are hungry note just walk a minute.

First off, the is NO breakfast. Second, the sliding doors both had frigid artic air drafting through, room temperature when we entered felt like 40Â°F. The heater did counter the cold, eventually. Draft was enough to keep the heater blowing full blast, all night, with the fan in "AUTO".

its not the hilton but overall its comfortable.... small fridge, microwave made it a pleasant stay.... there were cigarette burns in the bathtub but overall its not as bad as most are claiming. the place was very full and the front desk clerk was very nice...

Summary Heading: If you want a cheap rate and a good location...
Summary: We came to this property not knowing what to expect.  We came off the Amtrak in Anaheim, hopped a OCTA bus for about 5 minutes and were here.  Much to my delight, there was a laundromat around the corner.  Much to my honey's delight there was a taqueria.  The rooms are not super clean.  But clean enough.  The staff is friendly.  Give it a try!

Summary Heading: THINGS THAT GO BUMP IN THE NIGHT
Summary: stayed here for a week and kept hearing things in the ceiling.  for some reason my room had an attic access panel so i popped my head up there to see what was going on.  what i found was a bird caught in fishing line attached to a large rat trap.  the manager refused to do anything about the problem.  last time i'm staying here

I stayed in this motel with my family for a few days its dirty and the guy at the front desk was very rude. My room was dirty my bed sheets were stained and smelled bad my bathroom was so nasty the tub was dirty the toilet had blood on it there was ants all over the room my baby would nap and ants were on top of her I asked to get my room cleaned and not once did they clean it I had to clean it myself. This place is so dirty I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. STAY AWAY FROM THIS MOTEL!

These people don't issue you a receipt for cash payment.  I paid them a week's worth in cash and it took them 15 minutes before they were willing to finally hand me a receipt.  Stay away!  These people are new to the country, don't know the customs, and don't follow correct procedures.  They are unwilling to cooperate in a friendly way because they're not familiar with the capitalist system.  Also, they only clean your room every third day or so.

Summary Heading: Wasn't too bad, good for the price
Summary: The room that we got was fine to me. Nothing was really dirty about the room. It wasn't fantastic but it wasn't awful either. The lady up front was very kind and did a lot for us. For example, she lent us a microwavable dish for the microwave and even some plastic silverware. She was always willing to send the maids back to our room as well, if it was dirty. One night, they did run out of toilet paper for the whole motel though, which I thought was very odd. Unfortunately, there was no breakfast as it says on the website and they don't give you any sort of confirmation of reservations, they just write your name down because they don't know how to use the computer apparently. They give receipts for the nights stayed though and they take credit card (I know someone on Yelp said

The first room my boyfriend and I walked into was filthy. I had to pee badly, but one look at that toilet and I was repulsed. Urine and pubic hair on the seat. And to top it off, no toilet paper. The entire room looked like it had not been cleaned in days. My boyfriend went to talk to the front desk and they allowed him to look at other rooms. He said they looked the same. He went back and told the guy "hey just give me a clean room." The guy gave us his "best" room. This "lovely suite" had urine on the toilet, lots of hair displayed on the dirty floor, a grimey refrigerator, a nasty bathtub, and a mirror that had not been cleaned in years. This was the best?  Hey, I dont expect much from a motel. But cleanliness is basic. If a housekeeper were to dedicate a good amount of time

This place is disgusting. After finding this place after a long day at Disneyland my fiance and I couldnt wait to get some sleep.  When we got into the room my fiance set her bags down and went to use the bathroom. She let out a scream we'll never forget. The place was crawling with roaches. It was horrible. We picked our bags up off the floor and put them back into our car. We took pictures of the roaches in the room and went to the front desk to demand a refund. The manager at the front desk was very rude and said they never give refunds for any reason even though we stayed less than 5 minutes. I then showed him the pictures of the room covered in roaches and he agreed to refund our money if we deleted the pictures. This place is filthy. Please avoid it at all costs! You

In reply to the post on here saying there are vindictive and  exagerated comments??? This site is to help people find accomodation and the comments are to HELP people not to be vindictive to the Hotel. SInce our trip last year, I have heard of 5 other reports of people staying in this accomodation. One group after seeing their rooms promply grab their bags, dropped the key and remote back to reception, and with prying eyes on them jumped back into their cars and couldnt get out of there quick enough. Everyone is entitled to their opinion HOWEVER for the sake of future travellers to that area, at least be honest with comments regarding the place, which is what has been done with the majority of them. We are in the process of trying to find the photos we took of the following; -

Might not be the Hilton, but the price is right. Close to Disneyland and other points of interest. I have all ways had good service. I have been comming here over 2 years and have seen an improvment in the quality of the rooms. Again it is not the Hilton, but it all so isn't priced like the Hilton. There are a couple of reviews posted here that are very vindictive and seem to be exagerated. Again I am a frequent customer, not a resident and if this site wishes they may contact me. Thank you.

The check-in/reception area has plexiglass between the front desk person and you. There is a hole in the counter where you slide your check-in info under and they slide your TV remotes and room key to you. I guess this was clue #1 not to stay here. Sadly we booked this hotel the same day we needed to stay somewhere, through Expedia, so there were no refunds or else I would have asked for one.  We went to our 'non-smoking' room and the sheets had brown stains on them (we requested the 'maid service' come back through the room), we slept on top of the bed without the comforter, in blankets we brought for the trip. One of our 2 bath towels provided had a black tar-ish goo on it, so we had to take it back to the front desk and get a new towel, the min-fridge smelled like urine,

Summary Heading: AVOID AT ALL COSTS UNLESS YOU HAVE MACE!
Summary: This place looked great on the website and the location was ideal if you wanted to be near the Anaheim Convention Center.........what we got was an entirely different scenerio. The first night we were there, we came in late so it wasn't so bad. My fiance went to work the second day so i got to kick back and watch tv and work on my computer. I noticed that it was a residental motel which i normally don't mind but it was really ghetto in a hillbilly kind of way. I asked the owner if this was the case and he told me "no, there is noone here "long term"......<lie #1>........By that night, it was noisey, and I was starting to notice certain things about the room....like....the bathtub hadn't been cleaned since the Nixon Administration and the same with the carpet.  Day three was

There were electrical sockets hanging out of the walls, every lamp shade was broken, one of the light sockets was broken in half and still had a bulb in it, the beds were rock hard, and one of the rooms even had broken glass on the floor! We spoke to the front desk and they said they were remodeling and could do nothing about it. It did not feel safe or comfortable. I didn't even stay there because of that. Unfortunately the women working for me didn't have a choice.
